data.event: In 1861, David Millspaw became the first permanent settler in the area of what was to become Aurora.

event.title: was laid out as a town in 1871

data.event: Aurora was laid out as a town in 1871 by David Stone who named it after his former hometown of Aurora, Illinois.

event.title: was transferred from Orville City (an extinct town) to Aurora in 1876

data.event: The county seat was transferred from Orville City (an extinct town) to Aurora in 1876.
The largest hailstone ever recorded in the U.S. landed in Aurora on June 22, 2003.
